alert.note: Alert for Bedford (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 16 at 11:53PM CST until February 17 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Wartrace Creek Near Wartrace affecting Bedford County. For the Other Area Rivers...including Wartrace, Vernon...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Wartrace Creek Near Wartrace. * WHEN...From this evening to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Water begins to inundate Winette Ayers Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 PM CST Thursday the stage was 9.9 feet and rising. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM CST.
